question: If dad wasn't fighting and the war was over we wouldn't have to go.
answer: You will listen to your brother, won't you Edmund? Look after the others

question: I will mum
answer: You be a big girl now Susan, There now... off you go.

question: Uh, CH... gk, ch
answer: Were you hiding from me?

question: Huh, um, n..n.. no, I..I... I didn't want to scare you,
answer: if you don't mind my asking...what are you?

question: Why, I'm a faun! And you must be some beardless dwarf?
answer: I'm not a dwarf, I'm a girl! And actually I'm tallest in my class.

question: But you're saying, you're a daughter of Eve?
answer: Well, my mum's name is Helen...

question: Yes, but you are, in fact, human.
answer: Of course.

question: What are you doing here?
answer: Well, I came in through the wardrobe in the spare room, and-

question: Spare Oom, is that in Narnia?
answer: Narnia? What's that?

question: My dear girl, you're in it! Everything from the lamp post, all the way to castle Cair Paravel on the Eastern Sea, every stick and stone, every icicle, is Narnia,
answer: This is an awfully big wardrobe

question: I'm sorry, please allow me to introduce myself, my name is Tumnus
answer: Glad to meet you, Mr. Tumnus! *extends hand* I'm Lucy Pevensie. Oh, you shake it!

question: Why?
answer: I-I don't know! People do it when they meet each other.

question: Lucy Pevensie, from the shining city of War Drobe in the far land of Spare Oom, how would it be if you came and had tea with me?
answer: Oh! Well, thank you very much! But I probably should be getting back...

question: Oh, come on! It's not every day I get to make a new friend! And there's a... roaring fire! And toast and cakes! And maybe... we'll even break into the sardines.
answer: Well, maybe for just a little while... if you have... sardines.

question: By the bucket load, Come Along.
answer: Can I help you with that?

question: Why thank you! Oh... That is my father.
answer: He had a nice face. You look just like him.

question: No, were not alike at all really.
answer: My father is fighting in the war.

question: My father went away to war too... but that was a very long time ago... before this dreadful winter.
answer: Winter isn't all bad. There's ice skating and snow ball fights. Oh! And Christmas!

question: We haven't had Christmas in a hundred years here.
answer: No presents for a hundred years?

question: But, oh, you would have loved Narnia in spring! The Dryads and the Fauns would dance all night... but we never got tired. And oh, the music! Such music. Would you... like to hear some now?
answer: yes please

question: Now, are you familiar with the Narnia lullabies? Good, because this probably won't sound anything like one.
answer: Oh I must go

question: It's too late for that now I'm such a bad faun
answer: No. You're the nicest faun I've ever met.

question: Then I'm afraid you've had a very poor sampling.
answer: I'm sure you're very sorry, and you'll never do it again.

question: It's not something I have done, Lucy Pevensie. It's something I'm doing.
answer: What are you doing?

question: I'm kidnapping you. It's the White Witch, the one that makes it always winter, and never Christmas. She told me that I If I ever was to come across a son of Adam or a daughter of Eve, I am supposed to turn it over to her!
answer: But I thought you were my friend

question: We must move quietly the woods are full of her spies, even some of the trees are on her side
answer: I think so. Keep it, you need it more than I do.

question: Wait! What is your name Son-of-Adam?
answer: Edmund, your majesty.

question: And how was it, Edmund, that you came to enter my dominion?
answer: I walked through a wardrobe following my sister.

question: Your sister? How many are you?
answer: four

question: Edmund you look so cold! Come and sit with me here on my sledge. Now, would like something warm to drink.
answer: Yes...your majesty. How did you do that?

question: I can make anything you like.
answer: Could you make me taller?

question: I can make anything you like to eat
answer: Turkish Delight

question: I'd love to see your family
answer: They're nothing special

question: I have no children of my own and you are such a good little boy where I could see, one day, you becoming prince of Narnia - maybe even king.
answer: Really?

question: Of course you'd have to bring your family.
answer: They're nothing special Oh, Peter will be king too?

question: No! But a king needs servants.
answer: I-I guess I could bring 'em.

question: Beyond these woods, do you see those two little hills? My house is right between them. You'd love it there Edmund, it has whole rooms simply stuffed with Turkish Delight!
answer: Couldn't I have some more now?

question: NO! Don't want to ruin you appetite. I'm going to miss you Edmund. But we are going to see each other soon.
answer: I hope so.

question: Edmund? Oh Edmund!!!! I saw Mr. Tumnus again and he's fine!!! The White Witch hasn't found out about him helping me!
answer: The White Witch?

question: She calls herself the Queen of Narnia, but she really isn't. Edmund? Are you okay? You look awful.
answer: Well what do you expect! It's freezing! How do we get out of here?

question: No, not her - the forest!
answer: You're-you're not saying you believe her?

question: No, not her - the forest!
answer: You....you actually believe her?

question: What do they teach at these schools?
answer: Edmund said they were only pretending

question: And he's the more truthful one is he?
answer: No, this would be the first time.

question: Well then, id your sister isn't lying and isn't mad then logically we must assume that she is telling the truth. She's your sister, isn't she? You're a family! It's high time you start acting like one!
answer: Peter winds up, goes for the bowl!

question: Peter winds up, goes for the bowl!
answer: Ow!

question: Whoops! Wake up, Dolly Daydream!
answer: Can't we play hide and go seek again?

question: Not like there's air inside
answer: Are you ready then?

question: Are you?
answer: Well done, Ed!

question: Ow! Stop it!
answer: You little liar!

question: You didn't believe her either!
answer: Apologize to Lucy. Say you're sorry!

question: Well Mr. Tumnus it is
answer: We can't just walk around in these clothes!

question: We can use these coats.
answer: Peter, they don't belong to us.

question: That's better left for safer corners.
answer: He means the trees.

question: There is home sweet home.
answer: Oh, what a beautiful dam Mr. Beaver.

question: Merely a trifle.
answer: Is that you Beaver? I find out you've been out with Badger again I'll...Oh, they're not Badgers. I never thought I would see this day

question: I would have given you a week if I thought it would help
answer: Well you must be cold and hungry. Let's get you inside for some food and civilized conversation.

question: Enjoying the scenery, are we?
answer: Fish and sticks, dear.

question: You like it!
answer: Ye... yes, your majesty!

question: I thought you might Tell me, you sisters, are they deaf?
answer: No

question: and your brother, unintelligent?
answer: Well I think so, but mom says...

question: Then how dare you come alone! Edmund, I ask so little of you
answer: They just don't listen to me!

question: Couldn't even do that!
answer: I...I did bring them half way. There at the dam at the house of the beaver's!

question: Well...I guess your not a total lost then.
answer: Is there any chance I may have some more Turkish delight now?

question: This is what happens to the enemies of the White Witch.
answer: Stand still there traitor.

question: Relax, I'm one of the good guys
answer: Well you look mighty like one of the bad guys.

question: Are you gonna eat that?
answer: Mr... Tumnus.

question: Your Lucy Pevensies brother.
answer: I'm Edmund!

question: You have the same nose. Is your sister alright? Is she safe?
answer: I... I don't know!

question: I... I don't know!
answer: My wolves tore that dam apart, your little family was nowhere to be found. Where are they?!

question: I don't know..
answer: Then you are no longer any use to me...Guard

question: Wait they said something about Aslan
answer: Aslan! Where?

question: It hasn't been for a hundred years. But now the Witch's power is crumbling.
answer: Presents!

question: Lucy, Eve's Daughter. These are for you. The juice of the fire flower. If you, or one of your friends are wounded, one drop of this cordial will restore them. And though I do not expect you to use it, this.
answer: Well, I think I could be brave enough.

question: I'm sure you could. But battles are ugly affairs. Eve's Daughter, Susan. Trust in this bow, for it does not easily miss.
answer: What happened to, 'battles are ugly affairs?'

question: And, though you don't seem to have trouble making yourself heard, this. When you put this horn to your lips and blow it, wherever you are, help will come.
answer: Thanks.

question: Did you hear what he said... winter is almost over. You no what that means... no more ice!
answer: Wait, maybe we should think about this.

question: We don't have time.
answer: I was just trying to be realistic

question: Nice of you to drop by. I understand you were so helpful to my wolves last night.
answer: Forgive me your majesty

question: Don't waste my time with flattery.
answer: Not to seem rude, but I wasn't actually talking to you

question: Where is ASLAN! Answer me!
answer: Wait! The Beavers said something about the Stone Table and an army.

question: Thank you Edmund. It is good for this creature to see some honesty before he dies..
answer: NO!

question: I know dear and that makes the betrayal all the worse. It may be harder than you think That is Cair Paravel of the four thrones one of which you must sit as High King. You doubt the prophecy
answer: No, that's just it...you're not who I think I am

question: Peter Pevensie formerly of Finnchley. Beaver also said you wanted to turn him into a hat.
answer: I don't think I will be able.

question: You were able to get your family here.
answer: Not all of them.

question: Mother hasn't had a dress like this since before the war
answer: Maybe we had bring back a whole trunk load when we go home.

question: If we go home...Sorry I guess I am like that. Remember when we use to have fun?
answer: Yes, before you go boring.

question: It is true, he's gone
answer: Then you'll have to lead us. There's a whole army out there waiting to follow you.

question: I can't
answer: Aslan believed you could. And so do

question: We'll see him again.
answer: When?

question: In time...you mustn't press him, He isn't a tame lion...
answer: No, but he's good...
